metadata.description: Hypothetical $1B LBO waterfall - sources & uses. Based on typical transaction 2020-2024.
metadata.source: PE industry standard structures + SEC S-4/8-K filings (Dell, Petco, Bausch Health, etc.)
notes: The target company — not the PE firm — is responsible for the debt raised.
Transaction fees ($25M) are paid upfront to advisors but born by the company through higher debt needs.
Management fee at close ($150M) goes directly to the GP for 'monitoring' before any value creation.
Debt breakdown uses covenant-lite proliferation (2015+ market: 70-80% covenant-lite).

sources.label: Senior Secured Debt (First Lien)
sources.description: Revolving credit + Term Loan A (first lien, covenanted)

sources.label: Term Loan B (Covenant-Lite)
sources.description: Unsecured, no maintenance covenants (2007+ market standard)

sources.label: Mezzanine / 2nd Lien
sources.description: Subordinated, higher spread for lower seniority

sources.label: PIK Toggle Notes
sources.rate_range: 12-14% (toggle: pay in cash or add to principal)
sources.description: Payment-in-kind option: if cash is tight, accrue as debt

uses.label: Transaction Fees
uses.description: Investment bankers, legal, advisors (2.5% of deal size)

uses.label: Financing Fees
uses.description: Debt arrangers, documentation, agent fees (1.5% of debt raised)

uses.label: Management Fee at Close
uses.description: Paid to PE firm for 'monitoring' and advisory services (sometimes 15% of deal)

leverage_metrics.note: Actual leverage depends on target EBITDA. If $150M EBITDA, debt/EBITDA = ~4.3x. If $100M EBITDA, ~6.5x.
